intro: Sisyrinchium praealtum, commonly known as the tall blue-eyed grass, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, grass-like foliage and showy blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Sisyrinchium praealtum is often found in regions with well-drained soils and full sun exposure.
